dt: {bc}one or some indiscriminately of whatever kind:

dt.t: Ask {wi}any{/wi} man you meet.

dt: used to indicate one selected without restriction

dt.t: {wi}Any{/wi} child would know that.

dt: {bc}one, some, or all indiscriminately of whatever quantity:
used to indicate an undetermined number or amount

dt.t: Do you have {wi}any{/wi} money?

dt: used to indicate a maximum or whole

dt.t: He needs {wi}any{/wi} help he can get.

dt: {bc}a or some without reference to quantity or extent

dt.t: I'd be grateful for {wi}any{/wi} favor at all.

dt: {bc}unmeasured or unlimited in amount, number, or extent

dt.t: {wi}any{/wi} quantity you desire
could not endure it {wi}any{/wi} length of time

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}ǣnig{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}einag{/it} any, Old English {it}ān{/it} one {ma}{mat|one|}{/ma}
shortdef: one or some indiscriminately of whatever kind:
one or another taken at random
every —used to indicate one selected without restriction

fl: pronoun, singular or plural in construction

dt.t: I don't know {wi}any{/wi} of them.
The movie's opening scene is as powerful as {wi}any{/wi} I've seen.
You haven't eaten {wi}any{/wi} of your salad.
was never {wi}any{/wi} good
No, it doesn't help me {wi}any{/wi}.

shortdef: to any extent or degree : at all

dt: {bc}within the next few days {bc}in the near future {bc}soon

dt.t: We're expecting a phone call from him {it}any day now{/it}.
{it}Any day now{/it}, the decision could be made.

shortdef: within the next few days : in the near future : soon

dt.t: {it}Any fool{/it} can see that he's lying.

dt: usually used in negative statements to say that something that was once true or possible is not now true or possible

dt.t: We can't ignore these problems {it}any longer{/it}.
I can't afford the car {it}any longer{/it}.

shortdef: —usually used in negative statements to say that something that was once true or possible is not now true or possible

dt.t: The dish can be prepared in {it}any number of{/it} ways.

dt: used to describe someone or something that is not special or specific

dt.t: I don't care where I sleep. {it}Any old{/it} couch will do.
She won't drink just {it}any old{/it} tea; it has to be a certain kind.
Give me beer over champagne {phrase}any old day{/phrase} (of the week).

shortdef: —used to describe someone or something that is not special or specific

dt: used to refer to a person or thing that is not particular or specific but is not the one named or referred to

dt.t: {it}Any other{/it} day but tomorrow would be okay. There weren't {it}any other{/it} children for us to play with.

dt: {bc}in addition to the person or thing just mentioned

dt.t: Does anyone have {it}any other{/it} ideas?

shortdef: —used to refer to a person or thing that is not particular or specific but is not the one named or referred to
in addition to the person or thing just mentioned

dt: used to say that a person will use anyone or anything for comfort, help, etc., when in a bad situation

dt.t: "I know she's lonely, but I can't believe she's going out with that guy." "Well, you know what they say: {it}any port in a storm{/it}."

shortdef: —used to say that a person will use anyone or anything for comfort, help, etc., when in a bad situation
